sentences.zh: 魏之先，畢公高之後也。

translations.literal: Wei ancestors, Bi Gong Gao descendants.
translations.idiomatic: The ancestors of Wei were descendants of Bi Gong Gao.

sentences.zh: 畢公高與周同姓。

translations.literal: Bi Gong Gao with Zhou same surname.
translations.idiomatic: Bi Gong Gao shared the same surname with Zhou.

sentences.zh: 武王之伐紂，而高封於畢，於是為畢姓。

translations.literal: Wu Wang attacked Zhou, Gao enfeoffed at Bi, thus became Bi surname.
translations.idiomatic: When Wu Wang attacked Zhou, Gao was enfeoffed at Bi, thus becoming the Bi surname.

sentences.zh: 其後絕封，為庶人，或在中國，或在夷狄。

translations.literal: His descendants cut off enfeoffment, became commoners, some in central states, some among barbarians.
translations.idiomatic: His descendants lost their enfeoffment and became commoners, some in the central states, some among the barbarians.

sentences.zh: 其苗裔曰畢萬，事晉獻公。

translations.literal: His descendant called Bi Wan, served Jin Xian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: His descendant was called Bi Wan and served Jin Xian Gong.

sentences.zh: 獻公之十六年，趙夙為御，畢萬為右，以伐霍、耿、魏，滅之。

translations.literal: Xian Gong sixteenth year, Zhao Su as charioteer, Bi Wan as guard, attacked Huo, Geng, Wei, extinguished them.
translations.idiomatic: In Xian Gong's sixteenth year, Zhao Su was charioteer and Bi Wan was guard. They attacked Huo, Geng, and Wei, extinguishing them.

sentences.zh: 以耿封趙夙，以魏封畢萬，為大夫。

translations.literal: With Geng enfeoffed Zhao Su, with Wei enfeoffed Bi Wan, made grand master.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Su was enfeoffed with Geng, Bi Wan was enfeoffed with Wei, and made a grand master.

sentences.zh: 卜偃曰：「畢萬之後必大矣，萬，滿數也；

translations.literal: Bu Yan said: 'Bi Wan descendants certainly great, wan full number;
translations.idiomatic: Bu Yan said: 'Bi Wan's descendants will certainly be great. Wan is a full number.'

sentences.zh: 魏，大名也。

translations.literal: Wei great name.
translations.idiomatic: Wei is a great name.'

sentences.zh: 以是始賞，天開之矣，天子曰兆民，諸侯曰萬民。

translations.literal: With this begin reward, heaven opened it, Son of Heaven called myriad people, feudal lords called ten thousand people.
translations.idiomatic: With this beginning of reward, heaven has opened it. The Son of Heaven is called 'myriad people,' feudal lords 'ten thousand people.'

sentences.zh: 今命之大，以從滿數，其必有眾。」

translations.literal: Now name it great, follows full number, certainly have multitudes.'
translations.idiomatic: Now naming it great, following the full number, it will certainly have multitudes.'

sentences.zh: 初，畢萬卜事晉，遇屯之比。

translations.literal: Initially, Bi Wan divined serving Jin, encountered Tun of Bi.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when Bi Wan divined about serving Jin, he encountered Tun of Bi.

sentences.zh: 辛廖占之，曰：「吉。

translations.literal: Xin Liao divined it, said: 'Auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: Xin Liao divined it and said: 'Auspicious.'

sentences.zh: 屯固比入，吉孰大焉，其必蕃昌。」

translations.literal: Tun solid Bi enter, auspicious who greater than this, certainly multiply prosper.'
translations.idiomatic: Tun solid, Bi enter - what auspicious is greater than this? It will certainly multiply and prosper.'

sentences.zh: 畢萬封十一年，晉獻公卒，四子爭更立，晉亂。

translations.literal: Bi Wan enfeoffed eleven years, Jin Xian Gong died, four sons contended to establish, Jin chaos.
translations.idiomatic: Eleven years after Bi Wan was enfeoffed, Jin Xian Gong died. Four sons contended to be established. Jin was in chaos.

sentences.zh: 而畢萬之世彌大，從其國名為魏氏。

translations.literal: Bi Wan generation increasingly great, from his state name became Wei clan.
translations.idiomatic: Bi Wan's generation became increasingly great. From his state's name, they became the Wei clan.

sentences.zh: 生武子。

translations.literal: Gave birth to Wu Zi.
translations.idiomatic: He gave birth to Wu Zi.

sentences.zh: 魏武子以魏諸子事晉公子重耳。

translations.literal: Wei Wu Zi with Wei various sons served Jin prince Chong Er.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Wu Zi, along with the various sons of Wei, served Jin prince Chong Er.

sentences.zh: 晉獻公之二十一年，武子從重耳出亡。

translations.literal: Jin Xian Gong twenty-first year, Wu Zi followed Chong Er went into exile.
translations.idiomatic: In Jin Xian Gong's twenty-first year, Wu Zi followed Chong Er into exile.

sentences.zh: 十九年反，重耳立為晉文公，而令魏武子襲魏氏之後封，列為大夫，治於魏。

translations.literal: Nineteen years returned, Chong Er established as Jin Wen Gong, commanded Wei Wu Zi inherit Wei clan later enfeoffment, ranked as grand master, governed at Wei.
translations.idiomatic: After nineteen years they returned. Chong Er was established as Jin Wen Gong. He commanded Wei Wu Zi to inherit the Wei clan's later enfeoffment, ranked him as a grand master, and had him govern at Wei.

sentences.zh: 生悼子。

translations.literal: Gave birth to Dao Zi.
translations.idiomatic: He gave birth to Dao Zi.

sentences.zh: 魏悼子徙治霍。

translations.literal: Wei Dao Zi moved governance Huo.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Dao Zi moved his governance to Huo.

sentences.zh: 生魏絳。

translations.literal: Gave birth to Wei Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: He gave birth to Wei Jiang.

sentences.zh: 魏絳事晉悼公。

translations.literal: Wei Jiang served Jin Dao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Jiang served Jin Dao Gong.

sentences.zh: 悼公三年，會諸侯。

translations.literal: Dao Gong third year, assembled feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In Dao Gong's third year, he assembled the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 悼公弟楊干亂行，魏絳僇辱楊干。

translations.literal: Dao Gong younger brother Yang Gan chaotic conduct, Wei Jiang executed humiliated Yang Gan.
translations.idiomatic: Dao Gong's younger brother Yang Gan conducted himself chaotically. Wei Jiang executed and humiliated Yang Gan.

sentences.zh: 悼公怒曰：「合諸侯以為榮，今辱吾弟！」

translations.literal: Dao Gong angered said: 'Assemble feudal lords for glory, now humiliate my younger brother!'
translations.idiomatic: Dao Gong was angered and said: 'I assembled the feudal lords for glory, now you've humiliated my younger brother!'

sentences.zh: 將誅魏絳。

translations.literal: Would execute Wei Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: He would execute Wei Jiang.

sentences.zh: 或說悼公，悼公止。

translations.literal: Someone persuaded Dao Gong, Dao Gong stopped.
translations.idiomatic: Someone persuaded Dao Gong, and Dao Gong stopped.

sentences.zh: 卒任魏絳政，使和戎、翟，戎、翟親附。

translations.literal: Finally entrusted Wei Jiang governance, made peace with Rong, Di, Rong, Di closely attached.
translations.idiomatic: He finally entrusted Wei Jiang with governance and made peace with the Rong and Di tribes. The Rong and Di became closely attached.

sentences.zh: 悼公之十一年，曰：「自吾用魏絳，八年之中，九合諸侯，戎、翟和，子之力也。」

translations.literal: Dao Gong eleventh year, said: 'Since I used Wei Jiang, eight years within, nine assembled feudal lords, Rong, Di peaceful, your strength.'
translations.idiomatic: In Dao Gong's eleventh year, he said: 'Since I used Wei Jiang, within eight years, nine times assembled the feudal lords, Rong and Di are peaceful - this is your strength.'

sentences.zh: 賜之樂，三讓，然後受之。

translations.literal: Granted him music, three times declined, then accepted it.
translations.idiomatic: He granted him music. He declined three times, then accepted it.

sentences.zh: 徙治安邑。

translations.literal: Moved governance An Yi.
translations.idiomatic: He moved his governance to An Yi.

sentences.zh: 魏絳卒，謚為昭子。

translations.literal: Wei Jiang died, posthumous name Zhao Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Jiang died and was given the posthumous name Zhao Zi.

sentences.zh: 生魏嬴。

translations.literal: Gave birth to Wei Ying.
translations.idiomatic: He gave birth to Wei Ying.

sentences.zh: 嬴生魏獻子。

translations.literal: Ying gave birth to Wei Xian Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Ying gave birth to Wei Xian Zi.

sentences.zh: 獻子事晉昭公。

translations.literal: Xian Zi served Jin Zhao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Xian Zi served Jin Zhao Gong.

sentences.zh: 昭公卒而六卿彊，公室卑。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong died and six ministers strong, ducal house lowly.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Gong died and the six ministers grew strong, while the ducal house became lowly.

sentences.zh: 晉頃公之十二年，韓宣子老，魏獻子為國政。

translations.literal: Jin Qing Gong twelfth year, Han Xuan Zi aged, Wei Xian Zi made state governance.
translations.idiomatic: In Jin Qing Gong's twelfth year, Han Xuan Zi grew old, and Wei Xian Zi took charge of state governance.

sentences.zh: 晉宗室祁氏、羊舌氏相惡，六卿誅之，盡取其邑為十縣，六卿各令其子為之大夫。

translations.literal: Jin ducal clan Qi clan, Yang She clan mutually hateful, six ministers executed them, completely took their cities as ten counties, six ministers each commanded their sons to be grand masters for them.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin ducal clans Qi and Yang She were mutually hateful. The six ministers executed them and completely took their cities as ten counties. The six ministers each commanded their sons to be grand masters for them.

sentences.zh: 獻子與趙簡子、中行文子、范獻子并為晉卿。

translations.literal: Xian Zi with Zhao Jian Zi, Zhong Xing Wen Zi, Fan Xian Zi together became Jin ministers.
translations.idiomatic: Xian Zi, along with Zhao Jian Zi, Zhong Xing Wen Zi, and Fan Xian Zi, together became Jin ministers.

sentences.zh: 其後十四歲而孔子相魯。

translations.literal: Fourteen years later Confucius became Lu chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Fourteen years later, Confucius became chancellor of Lu.

sentences.zh: 後四歲，趙簡子以晉陽之亂也，而與韓、魏共攻范、中行氏。

translations.literal: Four years later, Zhao Jian Zi because Jin Yang rebellion, with Han, Wei together attacked Fan, Zhong Xing clans.
translations.idiomatic: Four years later, Zhao Jian Zi, because of the Jin Yang rebellion, together with Han and Wei attacked the Fan and Zhong Xing clans.

sentences.zh: 魏獻子生魏侈。

translations.literal: Wei Xian Zi gave birth to Wei Chi.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Xian Zi gave birth to Wei Chi.

sentences.zh: 魏侈與趙鞅共攻范、中行氏。

translations.literal: Wei Chi with Zhao Yang together attacked Fan, Zhong Xing clans.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Chi and Zhao Yang together attacked the Fan and Zhong Xing clans.

sentences.zh: 魏侈之孫曰魏桓子，與韓康子、趙襄子共伐滅知伯，分其地。

translations.literal: Wei Chi grandson called Wei Huan Zi, with Han Kang Zi, Zhao Xiang Zi together attacked extinguished Zhi Bo, divided his lands.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Chi's grandson was called Wei Huan Zi. He, with Han Kang Zi and Zhao Xiang Zi, together attacked and extinguished Zhi Bo, dividing his lands.

sentences.zh: 桓子之孫曰文侯都。

translations.literal: Huan Zi grandson called Wen Hou Du.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Zi's grandson was called Wen Hou Du.

sentences.zh: 魏文侯元年，秦靈公之元年也。

translations.literal: Wei Wen Hou first year, Qin Ling Gong first year.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Wen Hou's first year was Qin Ling Gong's first year.

sentences.zh: 與韓武子、趙桓子、周威王同時。

translations.literal: With Han Wu Zi, Zhao Huan Zi, Zhou Wei Wang contemporaneous.
translations.idiomatic: He was contemporaneous with Han Wu Zi, Zhao Huan Zi, and Zhou Wei Wang.

sentences.zh: 六年，城少梁。

translations.literal: Sixth year, walled Shao Liang.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, they walled Shao Liang.

sentences.zh: 十三年，使子擊圍繁、龐，出其民。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, sent Zi Ji surrounded Fan, Pang, moved out their people.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, he sent Zi Ji to surround Fan and Pang, moving out their people.

sentences.zh: 十六年，伐秦，筑臨晉元裏。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, attacked Qin, built Lin Jin Yuan Li.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, they attacked Qin and built Lin Jin Yuan Li.

sentences.zh: 十七年，伐中山，使子擊守之，趙倉唐傅之。

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, attacked Zhong Shan, sent Zi Ji guard it, Zhao Cang Tang assisted him.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, they attacked Zhong Shan. He sent Zi Ji to guard it, with Zhao Cang Tang assisting him.

sentences.zh: 子擊逢文侯之師田子方於朝歌，引車避，下謁。

translations.literal: Zi Ji encountered Wen Hou teacher Tian Zi Fang at Zhao Ge, pulled carriage aside, descended saluted.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Ji encountered Wen Hou's teacher Tian Zi Fang at Zhao Ge. He pulled his carriage aside and descended to salute.

sentences.zh: 田子方不為禮。

translations.literal: Tian Zi Fang did not return courtesy.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Zi Fang did not return the courtesy.

sentences.zh: 子擊因問曰：「富貴者驕人乎？

translations.literal: Zi Ji thus asked: 'Rich noble make arrogant people?
translations.idiomatic: Zi Ji thus asked: 'Do the rich and noble make people arrogant?

sentences.zh: 且貧賤者驕人乎？」

translations.literal: Moreover poor lowly make arrogant people?'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, do the poor and lowly make people arrogant?'

sentences.zh: 子方曰：「亦貧賤者驕人耳。

translations.literal: Zi Fang said: 'Also poor lowly make arrogant people.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Fang said: 'It is also the poor and lowly who make people arrogant.'

sentences.zh: 夫諸侯而驕人則失其國，大夫而驕人則失其家。

translations.literal: Indeed feudal lords arrogant then lose their state, grand masters arrogant then lose their house.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, if feudal lords are arrogant they lose their state. If grand masters are arrogant they lose their house.

sentences.zh: 貧賤者，行不合，言不用，則去之楚、越，若脫屣然，柰何其同之哉！」

translations.literal: Poor lowly, conduct not agreeable, words not used, then leave to Chu, Yue, like discarding shoes, how can compare them!'
translations.idiomatic: The poor and lowly - if their conduct is not agreeable and their words not used, they leave for Chu or Yue like discarding shoes. How can they be compared!'

sentences.zh: 子擊不懌而去。

translations.literal: Zi Ji displeased left.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Ji was displeased and left.

sentences.zh: 西攻秦，至鄭而還，筑雒陰、合陽。

translations.literal: West attacked Qin, reached Zheng returned, built Luo Yin, He Yang.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Qin to the west, reached Zheng and returned, building Luo Yin and He Yang.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，魏、趙、韓列為諸侯。

translations.literal: Twenty-second year, Wei, Zhao, Han ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Wei, Zhao, and Han were ranked as feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，秦伐我，至陽狐。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, Qin attacked us, reached Yang Hu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Qin attacked us and reached Yang Hu.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，子擊生子罃。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, Zi Ji gave birth to son Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Zi Ji gave birth to son Ying.

sentences.zh: 文侯受子夏經藝，客段干木，過其閭，未嘗不軾也。

translations.literal: Wen Hou received Zi Xia classics arts, hosted Duan Gan Mu, passed his alley, never not straightened carriage.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Hou received the classics and arts from Zi Xia. He hosted Duan Gan Mu. Passing his alley, he never failed to straighten his carriage.

sentences.zh: 秦嘗欲伐魏，或曰：「魏君賢人是禮，國人稱仁，上下和合，未可圖也。」

translations.literal: Qin once desired attack Wei, someone said: 'Wei lord respects worthy people with courtesy, state people call benevolent, upper lower harmonious united, not yet can plot.'
translations.idiomatic: Qin once desired to attack Wei. Someone said: 'The Wei lord respects worthy people with courtesy. The state people call him benevolent. Upper and lower are harmonious and united. He cannot yet be plotted against.'

sentences.zh: 文侯由此得譽於諸侯。

translations.literal: Wen Hou from this obtained reputation among feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Hou obtained reputation among the feudal lords from this.

sentences.zh: 任西門豹守鄴，而河內稱治。

translations.literal: Appointed Xi Men Bao guard Ye, and He Nei called well-governed.
translations.idiomatic: He appointed Xi Men Bao to guard Ye, and He Nei was called well-governed.

sentences.zh: 魏文侯謂李克曰：「先生嘗教寡人曰『家貧則思良妻，國亂則思良相』。

translations.literal: Wei Wen Hou told Li Ke said: 'Sir once taught me 'family poor then think good wife, state chaotic then think good chancellor'.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Wen Hou told Li Ke: 'Sir once taught me: 'When family is poor, think of a good wife. When state is chaotic, think of a good chancellor.'

sentences.zh: 今所置非成則璜，二子何如？」

translations.literal: Now placed either Cheng or Huang, these two sons how?'
translations.idiomatic: Now I have placed either Cheng or Huang. How are these two sons?'

sentences.zh: 李克對曰：「臣聞之，卑不謀尊，疏不謀戚。

translations.literal: Li Ke replied: 'Minister heard, lowly not plot honored, distant not plot close.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke replied: 'The minister has heard that the lowly do not plot for the honored, the distant do not plot for the close.'

sentences.zh: 臣在闕門之外，不敢當命。」

translations.literal: Minister at palace gate outside, not dare receive command.'
translations.idiomatic: The minister is outside the palace gate and does not dare receive the command.'

sentences.zh: 文侯曰：「先生臨事勿讓。」

translations.literal: Wen Hou said: 'Sir when facing affairs do not decline.'
translations.idiomatic: Wen Hou said: 'Sir, when facing affairs, do not decline.'

sentences.zh: 李克曰：「君不察故也。

translations.literal: Li Ke said: 'Lord not investigate reason.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke said: 'The lord does not investigate the reason.'

sentences.zh: 居視其所親，富視其所與，達視其所舉，窮視其所不為，貧視其所不取，五者足以定之矣，何待克哉！」

translations.literal: Residence observe who close, wealth observe who give to, success observe who raise, poverty observe what not do, poor observe what not take, five sufficient determine it, what wait for Ke!'
translations.idiomatic: Observe who they befriend when in residence. Observe who they give to when wealthy. Observe who they promote when successful. Observe what they do not do when poor. Observe what they do not take when impoverished. These five are sufficient to determine it. What need is there for Ke!'

sentences.zh: 文侯曰：「先生就舍，寡人之相定矣。」

translations.literal: Wen Hou said: 'Sir go to lodging, my chancellor decided.'
translations.idiomatic: Wen Hou said: 'Sir go to the lodging. My chancellor is decided.'

sentences.zh: 李克趨而出，過翟璜之家。

translations.literal: Li Ke hastened out, passed Di Huang home.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke hastened out and passed Di Huang's home.

sentences.zh: 翟璜曰：「今者聞君召先生而卜相，果誰為之？」

translations.literal: Di Huang said: 'Now heard lord summoned sir divined chancellor, indeed who for it?'
translations.idiomatic: Di Huang said: 'Now I heard the lord summoned sir to divine the chancellor. Indeed who will it be?'

sentences.zh: 李克曰：「魏成子為相矣。」

translations.literal: Li Ke said: 'Wei Cheng Zi became chancellor.'
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke said: 'Wei Cheng Zi became chancellor.'

sentences.zh: 翟璜忿然作色曰：「以耳目之所睹記，臣何負於魏成子？

translations.literal: Di Huang angrily changed color said: 'With ears eyes seen recorded, minister what inferior to Wei Cheng Zi?
translations.idiomatic: Di Huang angrily changed color and said: 'With what the ears and eyes have seen and recorded, what is the minister inferior to Wei Cheng Zi?

sentences.zh: 西河之守，臣之所進也。

translations.literal: Xi He guard, minister what advanced.
translations.idiomatic: The Xi He guard - what did the minister advance?'

sentences.zh: 君內以鄴為憂，臣進西門豹。

translations.literal: Lord internally with Ye as worry, minister advanced Xi Men Bao.
translations.idiomatic: The lord internally worried about Ye, and the minister advanced Xi Men Bao.'

sentences.zh: 君謀欲伐中山，臣進樂羊。

translations.literal: Lord planned desired attack Zhong Shan, minister advanced Yue Yang.
translations.idiomatic: The lord planned to attack Zhong Shan, and the minister advanced Yue Yang.'

sentences.zh: 中山以拔，無使守之，臣進先生。

translations.literal: Zhong Shan already captured, no one make guard it, minister advanced sir.
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Shan was already captured. No one to make guard it, and the minister advanced sir.'

sentences.zh: 君之子無傅，臣進屈侯鮒。

translations.literal: Lord son no tutor, minister advanced Qu Hou Fu.
translations.idiomatic: The lord's son had no tutor, and the minister advanced Qu Hou Fu.'

sentences.zh: 臣何以負於魏成子！」

translations.literal: Minister what inferior to Wei Cheng Zi!'
translations.idiomatic: What is the minister inferior to Wei Cheng Zi!'

sentences.zh: 李克曰：「且子之言克於子之君者，豈將比周以求大官哉？

translations.literal: Li Ke said: 'Moreover you words persuasive to your lord, how will form cliques seek high office?
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke said: 'Moreover, your words are persuasive to your lord. How will you form cliques to seek high office?

sentences.zh: 君問而置相『非成則璜，二子何如』？

translations.literal: Lord asked placed chancellor 'either Cheng or Huang, these two sons how'?
translations.idiomatic: The lord asked about placing a chancellor: 'Either Cheng or Huang, how are these two sons'?

sentences.zh: 克對曰：『君不察故也。

translations.literal: Ke replied: 'Lord not investigate reason.
translations.idiomatic: Ke replied: 'The lord does not investigate the reason.'

sentences.zh: 居視其所親，富視其所與，達視其所舉，窮視其所不為，貧視其所不取，五者足以定之矣，何待克哉！』

translations.literal: Residence observe who close, wealth observe who give to, success observe who raise, poverty observe what not do, poor observe what not take, five sufficient determine it, what wait for Ke!'
translations.idiomatic: Observe who they befriend when in residence. Observe who they give to when wealthy. Observe who they promote when successful. Observe what they do not do when poor. Observe what they do not take when impoverished. These five are sufficient to determine it. What need is there for Ke!'

sentences.zh: 是以知魏成子之為相也。

translations.literal: Therefore know Wei Cheng Zi became chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore I know Wei Cheng Zi became chancellor.'

sentences.zh: 且子安得與魏成子比乎？

translations.literal: Moreover you how can with Wei Cheng Zi compare?
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, how can you compare with Wei Cheng Zi?

sentences.zh: 魏成子以食祿千鐘，什九在外，什一在內，是以東得卜子夏、田子方、段干木。

translations.literal: Wei Cheng Zi with salary thousand zhong, nine tenths outside, one tenth inside, therefore to east obtained Bu Zi Xia, Tian Zi Fang, Duan Gan Mu.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Cheng Zi, with a salary of a thousand zhong, nine tenths spent outside, one tenth kept inside, therefore obtained to the east: Bu Zi Xia, Tian Zi Fang, and Duan Gan Mu.

sentences.zh: 此三人者，君皆師之。

translations.literal: These three, lord all took as teachers.
translations.idiomatic: These three, the lord all took as teachers.

sentences.zh: 子之所進五人者，君皆臣之。

translations.literal: You advanced five people, lord all made ministers.
translations.idiomatic: The five people you advanced, the lord all made ministers.'

sentences.zh: 子惡得與魏成子比也？」

translations.literal: You how can with Wei Cheng Zi compare?'
translations.idiomatic: How can you compare with Wei Cheng Zi?'

sentences.zh: 翟璜逡巡再拜曰：「璜，鄙人也，失對，願卒為弟子。」

translations.literal: Di Huang hesitantly bowed twice said: 'Huang, rustic person, wrong reply, wish finally become disciple.'
translations.idiomatic: Di Huang hesitantly bowed twice and said: 'Huang is a rustic person who gave the wrong reply. I wish to finally become a disciple.'

sentences.zh: 二十六年，虢山崩，壅河。

translations.literal: Twenty-sixth year, Guo Shan collapsed, blocked river.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Guo Shan collapsed and blocked the river.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，伐鄭。

translations.literal: Thirty-second year, attacked Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-second year, they attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 城酸棗。

translations.literal: Walled Suan Zao.
translations.idiomatic: They walled Suan Zao.

sentences.zh: 敗秦于注。

translations.literal: Defeated Qin at Zhu.
translations.idiomatic: They defeated Qin at Zhu.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，齊伐取我襄陵。

translations.literal: Thirty-fifth year, Qi attacked took our Xiang Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, Qi attacked and took our Xiang Ling.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，秦侵我陰晉。

translations.literal: Thirty-sixth year, Qin invaded our Yin Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, Qin invaded our Yin Jin.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，伐秦，敗我武下，得其將識。

translations.literal: Thirty-eighth year, attacked Qin, defeated our Wu below, obtained their general Shi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-eighth year, they attacked Qin, defeated us below Wu, and obtained their general Shi.

sentences.zh: 是歲，文侯卒，子擊立，是為武侯。

translations.literal: This year, Wen Hou died, Zi Ji established, this was Wu Hou.
translations.idiomatic: This year, Wen Hou died. Zi Ji was established. This was Wu Hou.

sentences.zh: 魏武侯元年，趙敬侯初立，公子朔為亂，不勝，奔魏，與魏襲邯鄲，魏敗而去。

translations.literal: Wei Wu Hou first year, Zhao Jing Hou first established, prince Shuo caused rebellion, not victorious, fled Wei, with Wei raided Han Dan, Wei defeated left.
translations.idiomatic: In Wei Wu Hou's first year, Zhao Jing Hou was first established. Prince Shuo caused rebellion, was not victorious, fled to Wei, raided Han Dan with Wei, Wei was defeated and left.

sentences.zh: 二年，城安邑、王垣。

translations.literal: Second year, walled An Yi, Wang Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, they walled An Yi and Wang Yuan.

sentences.zh: 七年，伐齊，至桑丘。

translations.literal: Seventh year, attacked Qi, reached Sang Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, they attacked Qi and reached Sang Qiu.

sentences.zh: 九年，翟敗我于澮。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Di defeated us at Kuai.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, the Di defeated us at Kuai.

sentences.zh: 使吳起伐齊，至靈丘。

translations.literal: Sent Wu Qi attack Qi, reached Ling Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: They sent Wu Qi to attack Qi, reaching Ling Qiu.

sentences.zh: 齊威王初立。

translations.literal: Qi Wei Wang first established.
translations.idiomatic: Qi Wei Wang was first established.

sentences.zh: 十一年，與韓、趙三分晉地，滅其後。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, with Han, Zhao divided Jin lands in three, extinguished their descendants.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, with Han and Zhao they divided Jin lands in three and extinguished their descendants.

sentences.zh: 十三年，秦獻公縣櫟陽。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Qin Xian Gong made county Yue Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Qin Xian Gong made Yue Yang a county.

sentences.zh: 十五年，敗趙北藺。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, defeated Zhao Bei Lin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, they defeated Zhao at Bei Lin.

sentences.zh: 十六年，伐楚，取魯陽。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, attacked Chu, took Lu Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, they attacked Chu and took Lu Yang.

sentences.zh: 武侯卒，子罃立，是為惠王。

translations.literal: Wu Hou died, son Ying established, this was Hui Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Hou died. Son Ying was established. This was Hui Wang.

sentences.zh: 惠王元年，初，武侯卒也，子罃與公中緩爭為太子。

translations.literal: Hui Wang first year, initially, Wu Hou died, son Ying with Gong Zhong Huan contended for crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: In Hui Wang's first year, initially when Wu Hou died, son Ying and Gong Zhong Huan contended for crown prince.

sentences.zh: 公孫頎自宋入趙，自趙入韓，謂韓懿侯曰：「魏罃與公中緩爭為太子，君亦聞之乎？

translations.literal: Gong Sun Si from Song entered Zhao, from Zhao entered Han, told Han Yi Hou said: 'Wei Ying with Gong Zhong Huan contend for crown prince, lord also heard it?
translations.idiomatic: Gong Sun Si from Song entered Zhao, from Zhao entered Han, told Han Yi Hou: 'Wei Ying and Gong Zhong Huan contend for crown prince. Has the lord also heard it?

sentences.zh: 今魏罃得王錯，挾上黨，固半國也。

translations.literal: Now Wei Ying obtained Wang Cuo, controls Shang Dang, certainly half state.
translations.idiomatic: Now Wei Ying has obtained Wang Cuo, controls Shang Dang, certainly half the state.

sentences.zh: 因而除之，破魏必矣，不可失也。」

translations.literal: Thus eliminate him, break Wei certainly, cannot lose.'
translations.idiomatic: Thus eliminate him, breaking Wei will be certain. Cannot lose this opportunity.'

sentences.zh: 懿侯說，乃與趙成侯合軍并兵以伐魏，戰于濁澤，魏氏大敗，魏君圍。

translations.literal: Yi Hou pleased, then with Zhao Cheng Hou combined armies united troops attacked Wei, battled at Zhu Ze, Wei clan greatly defeated, Wei lord surrounded.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Hou was pleased. He then combined armies with Zhao Cheng Hou and united troops to attack Wei. They battled at Zhu Ze. The Wei clan was greatly defeated. The Wei lord was surrounded.

sentences.zh: 趙謂韓曰：「除魏君，立公中緩，割地而退，我且利。」

translations.literal: Zhao told Han said: 'Eliminate Wei lord, establish Gong Zhong Huan, divide lands retreat, I will benefit.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao told Han: 'Eliminate the Wei lord, establish Gong Zhong Huan, divide the lands and retreat. I will benefit.'

sentences.zh: 韓曰：「不可。

translations.literal: Han said: 'Not possible.
translations.idiomatic: Han said: 'Not possible.

sentences.zh: 殺魏君，人必曰暴；

translations.literal: Kill Wei lord, people certainly call violent;
translations.idiomatic: Kill the Wei lord, and people will certainly call it violent;

sentences.zh: 割地而退，人必曰貪。

translations.literal: Divide lands retreat, people certainly call greedy.
translations.idiomatic: Divide the lands and retreat, and people will certainly call it greedy.

sentences.zh: 不如兩分之。

translations.literal: Not as good divide in two.
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to divide it in two.'

sentences.zh: 魏分為兩，不彊於宋、衛，則我終無魏之患矣。」

translations.literal: Wei divided in two, not stronger than Song, Wei, then I forever without Wei trouble.'
translations.idiomatic: If Wei is divided in two, not stronger than Song and Wei, then I will forever be without Wei's trouble.'

sentences.zh: 趙不聽。

translations.literal: Zhao not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao did not listen.

sentences.zh: 韓不說，以其少卒夜去。

translations.literal: Han not pleased, with their few troops night departed.
translations.idiomatic: Han was not pleased and departed at night with their few troops.

sentences.zh: 惠王之所以身不死，國不分者，二家謀不和也。

translations.literal: Hui Wang reason body not died, state not divided, two houses plans not harmonious.
translations.idiomatic: The reason Hui Wang's body did not die and the state was not divided was that the two houses' plans were not harmonious.

sentences.zh: 若從一家之謀，則魏必分矣。

translations.literal: If followed one house plan, then Wei certainly divided.
translations.idiomatic: If they had followed one house's plan, then Wei would certainly have been divided.

sentences.zh: 故曰「君終無適子，其國可破也」。

translations.literal: Therefore said 'Lord finally without legitimate son, his state can be broken.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore it is said: 'A lord who finally has no legitimate son - his state can be broken.'

sentences.zh: 二年，魏敗韓于馬陵，敗趙于懷。

translations.literal: Second year, Wei defeated Han at Ma Ling, defeated Zhao at Huai.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Wei defeated Han at Ma Ling and defeated Zhao at Huai.

sentences.zh: 三年，齊敗我觀。

translations.literal: Third year, Qi defeated our Guan.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Qi defeated our Guan.

sentences.zh: 五年，與韓會宅陽。

translations.literal: Fifth year, with Han met Zhai Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, they met with Han at Zhai Yang.

sentences.zh: 城武堵。

translations.literal: Walled Wu Du.
translations.idiomatic: They walled Wu Du.

sentences.zh: 為秦所敗。

translations.literal: Defeated by Qin.
translations.idiomatic: They were defeated by Qin.

sentences.zh: 六年，伐取宋儀臺。

translations.literal: Sixth year, attacked took Song Yi Tai.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, they attacked and took Song's Yi Tai.

sentences.zh: 九年，伐敗韓于澮。

translations.literal: Ninth year, attacked defeated Han at Kuai.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, they attacked and defeated Han at Kuai.

sentences.zh: 與秦戰少梁，虜我將公孫痤，取龐。

translations.literal: With Qin battled Shao Liang, captured our general Gong Sun Zao, took Pang.
translations.idiomatic: They battled with Qin at Shao Liang, captured our general Gong Sun Zao, and took Pang.

sentences.zh: 秦獻公卒，子孝公立。

translations.literal: Qin Xian Gong died, son Xiao Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Xian Gong died. His son Xiao Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 十年，伐取趙皮牢。

translations.literal: Tenth year, attacked took Zhao Pi Lao.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, they attacked and took Zhao's Pi Lao.

sentences.zh: 彗星見。

translations.literal: Comet appeared.
translations.idiomatic: A comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 十二年，星晝墜，有聲。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, star daytime fell, had sound.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, a star fell in daytime with a sound.

sentences.zh: 十四年，與趙會鄗。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, with Zhao met Hao.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, they met with Zhao at Hao.

sentences.zh: 十五年，魯、衛、宋、鄭君來朝。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, Lu, Wei, Song, Zheng lords came audience.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, the lords of Lu, Wei, Song, and Zheng came for audience.

sentences.zh: 十六年，與秦孝公會（社）［杜］平。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, with Qin Xiao Gong met Du Ping.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, they met with Qin Xiao Gong at Du Ping.

sentences.zh: 侵宋黃池，宋復取之。

translations.literal: Invaded Song Huang Chi, Song again took it.
translations.idiomatic: They invaded Song's Huang Chi, but Song took it back again.

sentences.zh: 十七年，與秦戰元裏，秦取我少梁。

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, with Qin battled Yuan Li, Qin took our Shao Liang.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, they battled with Qin at Yuan Li, and Qin took our Shao Liang.

sentences.zh: 圍趙邯鄲。

translations.literal: Surrounded Zhao Han Dan.
translations.idiomatic: They surrounded Zhao's Han Dan.

sentences.zh: 十八年，拔邯鄲。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, captured Han Dan.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, they captured Han Dan.

sentences.zh: 趙請救于齊，齊使田忌、孫臏救趙，敗魏桂陵。

translations.literal: Zhao requested aid from Qi, Qi sent Tian Ji, Sun Bin saved Zhao, defeated Wei at Gui Ling.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao requested aid from Qi. Qi sent Tian Ji and Sun Bin to save Zhao, defeating Wei at Gui Ling.

sentences.zh: 十九年，諸侯圍我襄陵。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, feudal lords surrounded our Xiang Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, the feudal lords surrounded our Xiang Ling.

sentences.zh: 筑長城，塞固陽。

translations.literal: Built long wall, blocked Gu Yang.
translations.idiomatic: They built a long wall and blocked Gu Yang.

sentences.zh: 二十年，歸趙邯鄲，與盟漳水上。

translations.literal: Twentieth year, returned Zhao Han Dan, allied on Zhang Shui.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, they returned Han Dan to Zhao and made an alliance on the Zhang Shui.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，與秦會彤。

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, with Qin met Tong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, they met with Qin at Tong.

sentences.zh: 趙成侯卒。

translations.literal: Zhao Cheng Hou died.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Cheng Hou died.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，齊威王卒。

translations.literal: Twenty-eighth year, Qi Wei Wang died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Qi Wei Wang died.

sentences.zh: 中山君相魏。

translations.literal: Zhong Shan Jun became chancellor of Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Shan Jun became chancellor of Wei.

sentences.zh: 三十年，魏伐趙，趙告急齊。

translations.literal: Thirtieth year, Wei attacked Zhao, Zhao urgently reported to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, Wei attacked Zhao, and Zhao urgently reported to Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊宣王用孫子計，救趙擊魏。

translations.literal: Qi Xuan Wang used Sun Zi plan, saved Zhao attacked Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Qi Xuan Wang used Sun Zi's plan to save Zhao and attack Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏遂大興師，使龐涓將，而令太子申為上將軍。

translations.literal: Wei then greatly raised troops, sent Pang Juan as general, commanded crown prince Shen as supreme general.
translations.idiomatic: Wei then greatly raised troops, sent Pang Juan as general, and commanded Crown Prince Shen as supreme general.

sentences.zh: 過外黃，外黃徐子謂太子曰：「臣有百戰百勝之術。」

translations.literal: Passed Wai Huang, Wai Huang Xu Zi told crown prince said: 'Minister has hundred battles hundred victories technique.'
translations.idiomatic: They passed Wai Huang. Wai Huang's Xu Zi told the crown prince: 'The minister has a technique of a hundred battles, a hundred victories.'

sentences.zh: 太子曰：「可得聞乎？」

translations.literal: Crown prince said: 'Can obtain hearing?'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince said: 'Can I hear it?'

sentences.zh: 客曰：「固願效之。」

translations.literal: Guest said: 'Certainly wish to present it.'
translations.idiomatic: The guest said: 'I certainly wish to present it.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「太子自將攻齊，大勝并莒，則富不過有魏，貴不益為王。

translations.literal: Said: 'Crown prince personally leads attacks Qi, greatly victorious annexes Ju, then wealth not exceed has Wei, nobility not increases becomes wang.
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'If the crown prince personally leads and attacks Qi, greatly victorious and annexes Ju, then wealth will not exceed having Wei, nobility will not increase to becoming wang.'

sentences.zh: 若戰不勝齊，則萬世無魏矣。

translations.literal: If battle not victorious over Qi, then ten thousand generations no Wei.
translations.idiomatic: If the battle is not victorious over Qi, then for ten thousand generations there will be no Wei.'

sentences.zh: 此臣之百戰百勝之術也。」

translations.literal: This minister hundred battles hundred victories technique.'
translations.idiomatic: This is the minister's technique of a hundred battles, a hundred victories.'

sentences.zh: 太子曰：「諾，請必從公之言而還矣。」

translations.literal: Crown prince said: 'Yes, please certainly follow sir words return.'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince said: 'Yes. I will certainly follow the sir's words and return.'

sentences.zh: 客曰：「太子雖欲還，不得矣。

translations.literal: Guest said: 'Crown prince though wants return, cannot.
translations.idiomatic: The guest said: 'Though the crown prince wants to return, he cannot.'

sentences.zh: 彼勸太子戰攻，欲啜汁者眾。

translations.literal: They urge crown prince battle attack, desire sip broth many.
translations.idiomatic: Those who urge the crown prince to battle and attack, desiring to sip the broth, are many.'

sentences.zh: 太子雖欲還，恐不得矣。」

translations.literal: Crown prince though wants return, fear cannot.'
translations.idiomatic: Though the crown prince wants to return, I fear he cannot.'

sentences.zh: 太子因欲還，其御曰：「將出而還，與北同。」

translations.literal: Crown prince thus wanted return, his charioteer said: 'General goes out returns, same as flees.'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince thus wanted to return. His charioteer said: 'The general goes out and returns - it's the same as fleeing.'

sentences.zh: 太子果與齊人戰，敗於馬陵。

translations.literal: Crown prince indeed with Qi people battled, defeated at Ma Ling.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince indeed battled with the Qi people and was defeated at Ma Ling.

sentences.zh: 齊虜魏太子申，殺將軍涓，軍遂大破。

translations.literal: Qi captured Wei crown prince Shen, killed general Juan, army thus greatly broken.
translations.idiomatic: Qi captured Wei's crown prince Shen, killed general Juan, and the army was thus greatly broken.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，秦、趙、齊共伐我，秦將商君詐我將軍公子卬而襲奪其軍，破之。

translations.literal: Thirty-first year, Qin, Zhao, Qi together attacked us, Qin general Shang Jun deceived our general prince Ang attacked seized his army, broke it.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Qin, Zhao, and Qi together attacked us. Qin general Shang Jun deceived our general Prince Ang and attacked to seize his army, breaking it.

sentences.zh: 秦用商君，東地至河，而齊、趙數破我，安邑近秦，於是徙治大梁。

translations.literal: Qin used Shang Jun, eastern lands reached He, but Qi, Zhao several times broke us, An Yi near Qin, thus moved governance Da Liang.
translations.idiomatic: Qin used Shang Jun. Eastern lands reached the He. But Qi and Zhao several times broke us. An Yi was near Qin. Thus they moved governance to Da Liang.

sentences.zh: 以公子赫為太子。

translations.literal: Made prince He crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: They made Prince He the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，秦孝公卒，商君亡秦歸魏，魏怒，不入。

translations.literal: Thirty-third year, Qin Xiao Gong died, Shang Jun fled Qin returned Wei, Wei angered, not admitted.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, Qin Xiao Gong died. Shang Jun fled Qin and returned to Wei. Wei was angered and did not admit him.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，與齊宣王會平阿南。

translations.literal: Thirty-fifth year, with Qi Xuan Wang met Ping A south.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, they met with Qi Xuan Wang south of Ping A.

sentences.zh: 惠王數被於軍旅，卑禮厚幣以招賢者。

translations.literal: Hui Wang several times defeated in military campaigns, humble courtesy thick gifts to recruit worthy people.
translations.idiomatic: Hui Wang was several times defeated in military campaigns. He used humble courtesy and thick gifts to recruit worthy people.

sentences.zh: 鄒衍、淳于髡、孟軻皆至梁。

translations.literal: Zou Yan, Chun Yu Kun, Meng Ke all arrived at Liang.
translations.idiomatic: Zou Yan, Chun Yu Kun, and Meng Ke all arrived at Liang.

sentences.zh: 梁惠王曰：「寡人不佞，兵三折於外，太子虜，上將死，國以空虛，以羞先君宗廟社稷，寡人甚丑之，叟不遠千里，辱幸至獘邑之廷，將何利吾國？」

translations.literal: Liang Hui Wang said: 'I not talented, troops three times defeated outside, crown prince captured, supreme general died, state because empty, shames former lord ancestral temples state altars, I very ashamed, old men not far thousand li, dishonored fortunate arrived crippled city court, will what benefit my state?'
translations.idiomatic: Liang Hui Wang said: 'I am not talented. Troops three times defeated outside. Crown prince captured. Supreme general died. State because empty. Shames former lord's ancestral temples and state altars. I am very ashamed. Old men not far thousand li, dishonored and fortunate to arrive at crippled city's court - what will benefit my state?'

sentences.zh: 孟軻曰：「君不可以言利若是。

translations.literal: Meng Ke said: 'Lord cannot speak profit like this.
translations.idiomatic: Meng Ke said: 'A lord cannot speak of profit like this.'

sentences.zh: 夫君欲利則大夫欲利，大夫欲利則庶人欲利，上下爭利，國則危矣。

translations.literal: Indeed lord desires profit then grand masters desire profit, grand masters desire profit then common people desire profit, upper lower contend profit, state then endangered.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed if the lord desires profit then grand masters desire profit. If grand masters desire profit then common people desire profit. Upper and lower contend for profit, and the state is then endangered.'

sentences.zh: 為人君，仁義而已矣，何以利為！」

translations.literal: Be person lord, benevolence righteousness only, what use profit!'
translations.idiomatic: To be a lord, benevolence and righteousness only. What use is profit!'

sentences.zh: 三十六年，復與齊王會甄。

translations.literal: Thirty-sixth year, again with Qi wang met Zhen.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, they again met with the Qi wang at Zhen.

sentences.zh: 是歲，惠王卒，子襄王立。

translations.literal: This year, Hui Wang died, son Xiang Wang established.
translations.idiomatic: This year, Hui Wang died. His son Xiang Wang was established.

sentences.zh: 襄王元年，與諸侯會徐州，相王也。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang first year, with feudal lords met Xu Zhou, mutually wang.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiang Wang's first year, they met with the feudal lords at Xu Zhou and mutually acknowledged as wang.

sentences.zh: 追尊父惠王為王。

translations.literal: Posthumously honored father Hui Wang as wang.
translations.idiomatic: They posthumously honored father Hui Wang as wang.

sentences.zh: 五年，秦敗我龍賈軍四萬五千于雕陰，圍我焦、曲沃。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Qin defeated our Long Jia army forty five thousand at Diao Yin, surrounded our Jiao, Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Qin defeated our Long Jia army of forty-five thousand at Diao Yin and surrounded our Jiao and Qu Wo.

sentences.zh: 予秦河西之地。

translations.literal: Gave Qin He Xi lands.
translations.idiomatic: They gave Qin the lands west of the He.

sentences.zh: 六年，與秦會應。

translations.literal: Sixth year, with Qin met Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, they met with Qin at Ying.

sentences.zh: 秦取我汾陰、皮氏、焦。

translations.literal: Qin took our Fen Yin, Pi Shi, Jiao.
translations.idiomatic: Qin took our Fen Yin, Pi Shi, and Jiao.

sentences.zh: 魏伐楚，敗之陘山。

translations.literal: Wei attacked Chu, defeated them at Xing Shan.
translations.idiomatic: Wei attacked Chu and defeated them at Xing Shan.

sentences.zh: 七年，魏盡入上郡于秦。

translations.literal: Seventh year, Wei completely entered Shang Jun to Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Wei completely entered Shang Jun to Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦降我蒲陽。

translations.literal: Qin descended our Pu Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Qin descended upon our Pu Yang.

sentences.zh: 八年，秦歸我焦、曲沃。

translations.literal: Eighth year, Qin returned our Jiao, Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Qin returned our Jiao and Qu Wo.

sentences.zh: 十二年，楚敗我襄陵。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Chu defeated our Xiang Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Chu defeated our Xiang Ling.

sentences.zh: 諸侯執政與秦相張儀會齧桑。

translations.literal: Feudal lords chief ministers with Qin chancellor Zhang Yi met Nie Sang.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords' chief ministers met with Qin chancellor Zhang Yi at Nie Sang.

sentences.zh: 十三年，張儀相魏。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Zhang Yi chancellor Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Zhang Yi became chancellor of Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏有女子化為丈夫。

translations.literal: Wei had woman transformed into man.
translations.idiomatic: Wei had a woman who transformed into a man.

sentences.zh: 秦取我曲沃、平周。

translations.literal: Qin took our Qu Wo, Ping Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Qin took our Qu Wo and Ping Zhou.

sentences.zh: 十六年，襄王卒，子哀王立。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, Xiang Wang died, son Ai Wang established.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Xiang Wang died. His son Ai Wang was established.

sentences.zh: 張儀復歸秦。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi again returned Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi again returned to Qin.

sentences.zh: 哀王元年，五國共攻秦，不勝而去。

translations.literal: Ai Wang first year, five states together attacked Qin, not victorious left.
translations.idiomatic: In Ai Wang's first year, five states together attacked Qin, were not victorious, and left.

sentences.zh: 二年，齊敗我觀津。

translations.literal: Second year, Qi defeated our Guan Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Qi defeated our Guan Jin.

sentences.zh: 五年，秦使樗里子伐取我曲沃，走犀首岸門。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Qin sent Chu Li Zi attacked took our Qu Wo, fled Xi Shou An Men.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Qin sent Chu Li Zi who attacked and took our Qu Wo, fled Xi Shou An Men.

sentences.zh: 六年，秦（求）［來］立公子政為太子。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Qin came established prince Zheng as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Qin came and established Prince Zheng as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 與秦會臨晉。

translations.literal: With Qin met Lin Jin.
translations.idiomatic: They met with Qin at Lin Jin.

sentences.zh: 七年，攻齊。

translations.literal: Seventh year, attacked Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, they attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 與秦伐燕。

translations.literal: With Qin attacked Yan.
translations.idiomatic: With Qin they attacked Yan.

sentences.zh: 八年，伐衛，拔列城二。

translations.literal: Eighth year, attacked Wei, captured ranked cities two.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, they attacked Wei and captured two ranked cities.

sentences.zh: 衛君患之。

translations.literal: Wei lord worried about it.
translations.idiomatic: The Wei lord was worried about it.

sentences.zh: 如耳約斬趙，趙分而為二，所以不亡者，魏為從主也。

translations.literal: Ru Er made agreement behead Zhao, Zhao divided became two, reason not perished, Wei was alliance leader.
translations.idiomatic: Ru Er made an agreement to behead Zhao. Zhao was divided and became two. The reason it did not perish was that Wei was the alliance leader.

sentences.zh: 今衛已迫亡，將西請事於秦。

translations.literal: Now Wei already urgently perishing, will west request service to Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Now Wei is already urgently perishing and will request service from Qin to the west.

sentences.zh: 與其以秦醳衛，不如以魏醳衛，見衛君曰：「請罷魏兵，免成陵君可乎？」

translations.literal: Rather than with Qin save Wei, not as good with Wei save Wei, saw Wei lord said: 'Please stop Wei troops, exempt Cheng Ling Jun possible?'
translations.idiomatic: Rather than saving Wei with Qin, it would be better to save Wei with Wei. He saw the Wei lord and said: 'Please stop the Wei troops. Is exempting Cheng Ling Jun possible?'

sentences.zh: 衛君曰：「先生果能，孤請世世以衛事先生。」

translations.literal: Wei lord said: 'Sir indeed able, I please generations with Wei serve sir.'
translations.idiomatic: The Wei lord said: 'If the sir is indeed able, I will have Wei serve the sir for generations.'

sentences.zh: 如耳見成陵君曰：「昔者魏伐趙，斷羊腸，拔閼與，衛之德魏必終無窮。」

translations.literal: Ru Er saw Cheng Ling Jun said: 'Formerly Wei attacked Zhao, cut Yang Chang, captured Yan Yu, Wei virtue to Wei certainly forever endless.'
translations.idiomatic: Ru Er saw Cheng Ling Jun and said: 'Formerly Wei attacked Zhao, cut Yang Chang, captured Yan Yu. Wei's virtue to Wei will certainly be forever endless.'

sentences.zh: 成陵君曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Cheng Ling Jun said: 'Yes.'
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Ling Jun said: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 如耳見魏王曰：「臣有謁於衛。

translations.literal: Ru Er saw Wei wang said: 'Minister has petition to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Ru Er saw the Wei wang and said: 'The minister has a petition regarding Wei.'

sentences.zh: 衛故周室之別也，其稱小國，多寶器。

translations.literal: Wei formerly Zhou house branch, called small state, many treasure vessels.
translations.idiomatic: Wei was formerly a branch of the Zhou house. It is called a small state but has many treasure vessels.

sentences.zh: 今國迫於難而寶器不出者，其心以為攻衛醳衛不以王為主，故寶器雖出必不入於王也。

translations.literal: Now state pressed by difficulty but treasure vessels not come out, their hearts think attack Wei save Wei not with wang as master, therefore treasure vessels though come out certainly not enter wang.
translations.idiomatic: Now the state is pressed by difficulty but treasure vessels do not come out. Their hearts think that attacking Wei to save Wei does not take the wang as master. Therefore treasure vessels, though they come out, will certainly not enter the wang.

sentences.zh: 臣竊料之，先言醳衛者必受衛者也。」

translations.literal: Minister secretly calculates it, first speak save Wei certainly receive Wei.'
translations.idiomatic: The minister secretly calculates it: the first to speak of saving Wei will certainly receive Wei.'

sentences.zh: 如耳出，成陵君入，以其言見魏王。

translations.literal: Ru Er exited, Cheng Ling Jun entered, with his words saw Wei wang.
translations.idiomatic: Ru Er exited. Cheng Ling Jun entered and saw the Wei wang with his words.

sentences.zh: 魏王聽其說，罷其兵，免成陵君，終身不見。

translations.literal: Wei wang listened to his explanation, stopped their troops, exempted Cheng Ling Jun, lifetime not see.
translations.idiomatic: The Wei wang listened to his explanation, stopped their troops, exempted Cheng Ling Jun, and never saw him for life.

sentences.zh: 九年，與秦王會臨晉。

translations.literal: Ninth year, with Qin wang met Lin Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, they met with the Qin wang at Lin Jin.

sentences.zh: 張儀、魏章皆歸于魏。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi, Wei Zhang all returned to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi and Wei Zhang all returned to Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏相田需死，楚害張儀、犀首、薛公。

translations.literal: Wei chancellor Tian Xu died, Chu harmed Zhang Yi, Xi Shou, Xue Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Wei chancellor Tian Xu died. Chu harmed Zhang Yi, Xi Shou, and Xue Gong.

sentences.zh: 楚相昭魚謂蘇代曰：「田需死，吾恐張儀、犀首、薛公有一人相魏者也。」

translations.literal: Chu chancellor Zhao Yu told Su Dai said: 'Tian Xu died, I fear Zhang Yi, Xi Shou, Xue Gong have one chancellor Wei.'
translations.idiomatic: Chu chancellor Zhao Yu told Su Dai: 'Tian Xu died. I fear that Zhang Yi, Xi Shou, or Xue Gong will have one as chancellor of Wei.'

sentences.zh: 代曰：「然相者欲誰而君便之？」

translations.literal: Dai said: 'So chancellor want who and lord convenient it?'
translations.idiomatic: Dai said: 'So who does the chancellor want and whom does the lord find convenient?'

sentences.zh: 昭魚曰：「吾欲太子之自相也。」

translations.literal: Zhao Yu said: 'I want crown prince self chancellor.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yu said: 'I want the crown prince to chancellor himself.'

sentences.zh: 代曰：「請為君北，必相之。」

translations.literal: Dai said: 'Please for lord north, certainly chancellor it.'
translations.idiomatic: Dai said: 'I will go north for the lord and certainly make him chancellor.'

sentences.zh: 昭魚曰：「柰何？」

translations.literal: Zhao Yu said: 'How?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yu said: 'How?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「君其為梁王，代請說君。」

translations.literal: Replied: 'Lord become Liang wang, Dai please persuade lord.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'The lord should become Liang wang. Dai will please persuade the lord.'

sentences.zh: 昭魚曰：「柰何？」

translations.literal: Zhao Yu said: 'How?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yu said: 'How?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「代也從楚來，昭魚甚憂，曰：『田需死，吾恐張儀、犀首、薛公有一人相魏者也。』

translations.literal: Replied: 'Dai from Chu come, Zhao Yu very worried, said: 'Tian Xu died, I fear Zhang Yi, Xi Shou, Xue Gong have one chancellor Wei.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Dai came from Chu. Zhao Yu was very worried and said: 'Tian Xu died. I fear Zhang Yi, Xi Shou, or Xue Gong will have one as chancellor of Wei.'

sentences.zh: 代曰：『梁王，長主也，必不相張儀。

translations.literal: Dai said: 'Liang wang, senior lord, certainly not chancellor Zhang Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Dai said: 'Liang wang is a senior lord. He certainly will not make Zhang Yi chancellor.'

sentences.zh: 張儀相，必右秦而左魏。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi chancellor, certainly favor Qin left Wei.
translations.idiomatic: If Zhang Yi is chancellor, he will certainly favor Qin and slight Wei.'

sentences.zh: 犀首相，必右韓而左魏。

translations.literal: Xi Shou chancellor, certainly favor Han left Wei.
translations.idiomatic: If Xi Shou is chancellor, he will certainly favor Han and slight Wei.'

sentences.zh: 薛公相，必右齊而左魏。

translations.literal: Xue Gong chancellor, certainly favor Qi left Wei.
translations.idiomatic: If Xue Gong is chancellor, he will certainly favor Qi and slight Wei.'

sentences.zh: 梁王，長主也，必不便也。』

translations.literal: Liang wang, senior lord, certainly not convenient.'
translations.idiomatic: Liang wang is a senior lord. He certainly will not find it convenient.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：『然則寡人孰相？』

translations.literal: Wang said: 'So then I who chancellor?'
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'So then who should I make chancellor?'

sentences.zh: 代曰：『莫若太子之自相。

translations.literal: Dai said: 'Nothing better than crown prince self chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Dai said: 'Nothing is better than the crown prince chancelloring himself.'

sentences.zh: 太子之自相，是三人者皆以太子為非常相也，皆將務以其國事魏，欲得丞相璽也。

translations.literal: Crown prince self chancellor, these three all consider crown prince not ordinary chancellor, all will strive with their states serve Wei, desire obtain chancellor seal.
translations.idiomatic: If the crown prince chancellors himself, these three will all consider the crown prince an extraordinary chancellor. They will all strive to have their states serve Wei in order to obtain the chancellor seal.'

sentences.zh: 以魏之彊，而三萬乘之國輔之，魏必安矣。

translations.literal: With Wei strong, three ten thousand chariot states assist it, Wei certainly peaceful.
translations.idiomatic: With Wei's strength, and three ten-thousand-chariot states assisting it, Wei will certainly be peaceful.'

sentences.zh: 故曰莫若太子之自相也。』」

translations.literal: Therefore said nothing better than crown prince self chancellor.''
translations.idiomatic: Therefore it is said: nothing is better than the crown prince chancelloring himself.''

sentences.zh: 遂北見梁王，以此告之。

translations.literal: Then north saw Liang wang, with this told him.
translations.idiomatic: He then went north and saw the Liang wang, telling him this.

sentences.zh: 太子果相魏。

translations.literal: Crown prince indeed chancellor Wei.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince indeed became chancellor of Wei.

sentences.zh: 十年，張儀死。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Zhang Yi died.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Zhang Yi died.

sentences.zh: 十一年，與秦武王會應。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, with Qin Wu Wang met Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, they met with Qin Wu Wang at Ying.

sentences.zh: 十二年，太子朝於秦。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, crown prince audience in Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, the crown prince went for audience in Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦來伐我皮氏，未拔而解。

translations.literal: Qin came attacked our Pi Shi, not captured retreated.
translations.idiomatic: Qin came and attacked our Pi Shi, but did not capture it and retreated.

sentences.zh: 十四年，秦來歸武王后。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, Qin came returned Wu Wang queen.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Qin came and returned the Wu Wang queen.

sentences.zh: 十六年，秦拔我蒲反、陽晉、封陵。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, Qin captured our Pu Fan, Yang Jin, Feng Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Qin captured our Pu Fan, Yang Jin, and Feng Ling.

sentences.zh: 十七年，與秦會臨晉。

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, with Qin met Lin Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, they met with Qin at Lin Jin.

sentences.zh: 秦予我蒲反。

translations.literal: Qin gave us Pu Fan.
translations.idiomatic: Qin gave us Pu Fan.

sentences.zh: 十八年，與秦伐楚。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, with Qin attacked Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, they attacked Chu with Qin.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，與齊、韓共敗秦軍函谷。

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, with Qi, Han together defeated Qin army Han Gu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, with Qi and Han they together defeated the Qin army at Han Gu.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，秦復予我河外及封陵為和。

translations.literal: Twenty-third year, Qin again gave us He outside and Feng Ling for peace.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Qin again gave us lands outside the He and Feng Ling for peace.

sentences.zh: 哀王卒，子昭王立。

translations.literal: Ai Wang died, son Zhao Wang established.
translations.idiomatic: Ai Wang died. His son Zhao Wang was established.

sentences.zh: 昭王元年，秦拔我襄城。

translations.literal: Zhao Wang first year, Qin captured our Xiang Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: In Zhao Wang's first year, Qin captured our Xiang Cheng.

sentences.zh: 二年，與秦戰，我不利。

translations.literal: Second year, with Qin battled, we unfavorable.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, they battled with Qin, and we were unfavorable.

sentences.zh: 三年，佐韓攻秦，秦將白起敗我軍伊闕二十四萬。

translations.literal: Third year, assisted Han attacked Qin, Qin general Bai Qi defeated our army Yi Que twenty four ten thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, assisting Han they attacked Qin. Qin general Bai Qi defeated our army at Yi Que - twenty-four ten thousand.

sentences.zh: 六年，予秦河東地方四百里。

translations.literal: Sixth year, gave Qin He Dong area four hundred li.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, they gave Qin four hundred li of land east of the He.

sentences.zh: 芒卯以詐重。

translations.literal: Mang Mao with deceit heavy.
translations.idiomatic: Mang Mao became important through deceit.

sentences.zh: 七年，秦拔我城大小六十一。

translations.literal: Seventh year, Qin captured our cities large small sixty one.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Qin captured sixty-one of our cities, large and small.

sentences.zh: 八年，秦昭王為西帝，齊湣王為東帝，月餘，皆復稱王歸帝。

translations.literal: Eighth year, Qin Zhao Wang became Western Di, Qi Min Wang became Eastern Di, month remaining, all again called wang returned Di.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Qin Zhao Wang became Western Di and Qi Min Wang became Eastern Di. After more than a month, they all again called themselves wang and returned the Di titles.

sentences.zh: 九年，秦拔我新垣、曲陽之城。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Qin captured our Xin Yuan, Qu Yang cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Qin captured our cities of Xin Yuan and Qu Yang.

sentences.zh: 十年，齊滅宋，宋王死我溫。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Qi extinguished Song, Song wang died our Wen.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Qi extinguished Song. The Song wang died at our Wen.

sentences.zh: 十二年，與秦、趙、韓、燕共伐齊，敗之濟西，湣王出亡。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, with Qin, Zhao, Han, Yan together attacked Qi, defeated it Ji west, Min Wang fled.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, with Qin, Zhao, Han, and Yan they together attacked Qi, defeated it west of Ji, and Min Wang fled.

sentences.zh: 燕獨入臨菑。

translations.literal: Yan alone entered Lin Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Yan alone entered Lin Zi.

sentences.zh: 與秦王會西周。

translations.literal: With Qin wang met Xi Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: They met with the Qin wang at Xi Zhou.

sentences.zh: 十三年，秦拔我安城。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Qin captured our An Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Qin captured our An Cheng.

sentences.zh: 兵到大梁，去。

translations.literal: Troops arrived Da Liang, left.
translations.idiomatic: Troops arrived at Da Liang and left.

sentences.zh: 十八年，秦拔郢，楚王徙陳。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, Qin captured Ying, Chu wang moved Chen.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Qin captured Ying. The Chu wang moved to Chen.

sentences.zh: 十九年，昭王卒，子安釐王立。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, Zhao Wang died, son An Xi Wang established.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Zhao Wang died. His son An Xi Wang was established.

sentences.zh: 安釐王元年，秦拔我兩城。

translations.literal: An Xi Wang first year, Qin captured our two cities.
translations.idiomatic: In An Xi Wang's first year, Qin captured our two cities.

sentences.zh: 二年，又拔我二城，軍大梁下，韓來救，予秦溫以和。

translations.literal: Second year, again captured our two cities, army Da Liang below, Han came save, gave Qin Wen for peace.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, they again captured our two cities. Army below Da Liang. Han came to save. They gave Qin Wen for peace.

sentences.zh: 三年，秦拔我四城，斬首四萬。

translations.literal: Third year, Qin captured our four cities, beheaded forty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Qin captured our four cities and beheaded forty thousand.

sentences.zh: 四年，秦破我及韓、趙，殺十五萬人，走我將芒卯。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Qin broke us and Han, Zhao, killed fifteen ten thousand people, fled our general Mang Mao.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Qin broke us along with Han and Zhao, killed one hundred fifty thousand people, and our general Mang Mao fled.

sentences.zh: 魏將段干子請予秦南陽以和。

translations.literal: Wei general Duan Gan Zi requested give Qin Nan Yang for peace.
translations.idiomatic: Wei general Duan Gan Zi requested giving Qin Nan Yang for peace.

sentences.zh: 蘇代謂魏王曰：「欲璽者段干子也，欲地者秦也。

translations.literal: Su Dai told Wei wang said: 'Desire seal Duan Gan Zi, desire land Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Su Dai told the Wei wang: 'The one who desires the seal is Duan Gan Zi. The one who desires land is Qin.'

sentences.zh: 今王使欲地者制璽，使欲璽者制地，魏氏地不盡則不知已。

translations.literal: Now wang makes desire land control seal, makes desire seal control land, Wei clan land not exhausted then not know stop.
translations.idiomatic: Now the wang makes the one who desires land control the seal, makes the one who desires the seal control the land. The Wei clan's land will not be exhausted and then they won't know to stop.

sentences.zh: 且夫以地事秦，譬猶抱薪救火，薪不盡，火不滅。」

translations.literal: Moreover with land serve Qin, like embrace firewood save fire, firewood not exhausted, fire not extinguish.'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, serving Qin with land is like embracing firewood to save a fire - the firewood won't be exhausted, the fire won't extinguish.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「是則然也。

translations.literal: Wang said: 'This then so.
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'This is then so.'

sentences.zh: 雖然，事始已行，不可更矣。」

translations.literal: Although, matter already begun, cannot change.'
translations.idiomatic: Although, the matter has already begun and cannot be changed.'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「王獨不見夫博之所以貴梟者，便則食，不便則止矣。

translations.literal: Replied: 'Wang alone not see gambling why value owl, convenient then eat, inconvenient then stop.
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Does the wang alone not see why gambling values the owl? When convenient, then eat. When inconvenient, then stop.'

sentences.zh: 今王曰『事始已行，不可更』，是何王之用智不如用梟也？」

translations.literal: Now wang says 'matter begun, cannot change', this why wang use wisdom not equal use owl?'
translations.idiomatic: Now the wang says 'the matter has begun and cannot be changed' - why does the wang's use of wisdom not equal using an owl?'

sentences.zh: 九年，秦拔我懷。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Qin captured our Huai.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Qin captured our Huai.

sentences.zh: 十年，秦太子外質於魏死。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Qin crown prince hostage in Wei died.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, the Qin crown prince, a hostage in Wei, died.

sentences.zh: 十一年，秦拔我郪丘。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Qin captured our Cheng Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Qin captured our Cheng Qiu.

sentences.zh: 秦昭王謂左右曰：「今時韓、魏與始孰彊？」

translations.literal: Qin Zhao Wang told attendants said: 'Now time Han, Wei with beginning who strong?'
translations.idiomatic: Qin Zhao Wang told his attendants: 'At the present time, are Han and Wei stronger than at the beginning?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不如始彊。」

translations.literal: Replied: 'Not as strong as beginning.'
translations.idiomatic: They replied: 'Not as strong as at the beginning.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「今時如耳、魏齊與孟嘗、芒卯孰賢？」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Now time Ru Er, Wei Qi with Meng Chang, Mang Mao who worthy?'
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'At the present time, are Ru Er and Wei Qi more worthy than Meng Chang and Mang Mao?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不如。」

translations.literal: Replied: 'Not as.'
translations.idiomatic: They replied: 'Not as worthy.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「以孟嘗、芒卯之賢，率彊韓、魏以攻秦，猶無柰寡人何也。

translations.literal: Wang said: 'With Meng Chang, Mang Mao worthy, lead strong Han, Wei attack Qin, still nothing can do to me.
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'Even with Meng Chang and Mang Mao's worthiness, leading strong Han and Wei to attack Qin, they still could do nothing to me.'

sentences.zh: 今以無能之如耳、魏齊而率弱韓、魏以伐秦，其無柰寡人何亦明矣。」

translations.literal: Now with incapable Ru Er, Wei Qi lead weak Han, Wei attack Qin, their nothing can do to me also clear.'
translations.idiomatic: Now with the incapable Ru Er and Wei Qi leading weak Han and Wei to attack Qin, that they can do nothing to me is also clear.'

sentences.zh: 左右皆曰：「甚然。」

translations.literal: Attendants all said: 'Very so.'
translations.idiomatic: All his attendants said: 'Very much so.'

sentences.zh: 中旗馮琴而對曰：「王之料天下過矣。

translations.literal: Zhong Qi Feng Qin leaned on qin replied said: 'Wang's assessment of world excessive.
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Qi Feng Qin leaned on his qin and replied: 'Your Majesty's assessment of the world is excessive.'

sentences.zh: 當晉六卿之時，知氏最彊，滅范、中行，又率韓、魏之兵以圍趙襄子於晉陽，決晉水以灌晉陽之城，不湛者三版。

translations.literal: When Jin six ministers time, Zhi clan strongest, extinguished Fan, Zhong Hang, moreover led Han, Wei troops to besiege Zhao Xiang Zi at Jin Yang, breached Jin water to flood Jin Yang city, not submerged three boards.
translations.idiomatic: During the time of the six Jin ministers, the Zhi clan was strongest. They extinguished the Fan and Zhong Hang clans, and moreover led Han and Wei troops to besiege Zhao Xiang Zi at Jin Yang. They breached the Jin River to flood Jin Yang's city, leaving only three boards unsubmerged.

sentences.zh: 知伯行水，魏桓子御，韓康子為參乘。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo directed water, Wei Huan Zi drove, Han Kang Zi was second rider.
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Bo directed the flooding, Wei Huan Zi drove the chariot, and Han Kang Zi was the second rider.

sentences.zh: 知伯曰：『吾始不知水之可以亡人之國也，乃今知之。』

translations.literal: Zhi Bo said: 'I initially not know water can destroy person's state, now know it.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Bo said: 'I initially did not know that water could destroy a person's state. Only now do I know it.'

sentences.zh: 汾水可以灌安邑，絳水可以灌平陽。

translations.literal: Fen water can flood An Yi, Jiang water can flood Ping Yang.
translations.idiomatic: The Fen River can flood An Yi. The Jiang River can flood Ping Yang.

sentences.zh: 魏桓子肘韓康子，韓康子履魏桓子，肘足接於車上，而知氏地分，身死國亡，為天下笑。

translations.literal: Wei Huan Zi elbowed Han Kang Zi, Han Kang Zi stepped on Wei Huan Zi, elbows feet connected on chariot, and Zhi clan land divided, body died state perished, became world laugh.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Huan Zi elbowed Han Kang Zi. Han Kang Zi stepped on Wei Huan Zi. Their elbows and feet connected on the chariot. The Zhi clan's land was divided. Zhi Bo died and his state perished. He became the world's laughingstock.

sentences.zh: 今秦兵雖彊，不能過知氏；

translations.literal: Now Qin troops though strong, cannot exceed Zhi clan;
translations.idiomatic: Now Qin's troops, though strong, cannot exceed the Zhi clan.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏雖弱，尚賢其在晉陽之下也。

translations.literal: Han, Wei though weak, still surpass them under Jin Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Han and Wei, though weak, still surpass them from under Jin Yang.

sentences.zh: 此方其用肘足之時也，願王之勿易也！」

translations.literal: This just their use elbows feet time, wish wang not treat lightly!'
translations.idiomatic: This is just the time they will use elbows and feet. I wish Your Majesty not to treat it lightly!'

sentences.zh: 於是秦王恐。

translations.literal: Thus Qin wang feared.
translations.idiomatic: Thus the Qin wang became fearful.

sentences.zh: 齊、楚相約而攻魏，魏使人求救於秦，冠蓋相望也，而秦救不至。

translations.literal: Qi, Chu allied attacked Wei, Wei sent people seek rescue from Qin, crowns canopies mutually see, but Qin rescue not arrive.
translations.idiomatic: Qi and Chu allied and attacked Wei. Wei sent people to seek rescue from Qin. Their official carriages were in constant view, but Qin's rescue did not arrive.

sentences.zh: 魏人有唐雎者，年九十餘矣，謂魏王曰：「老臣請西說秦王，令兵先臣出。」

translations.literal: Wei person named Tang Ju, age ninety remainder, told Wei wang said: 'Old minister request west persuade Qin wang, make troops before minister leave.'
translations.idiomatic: There was a Wei person named Tang Ju, over ninety years old. He told the Wei wang: 'This old minister requests to go west and persuade the Qin wang, so that the troops leave before me.'

sentences.zh: 魏王再拜，遂約車而遣之。

translations.literal: Wei wang twice bowed, thus hitched chariot sent him.
translations.idiomatic: The Wei wang bowed twice and thus hitched a chariot to send him.

sentences.zh: 唐雎到，入見秦王。

translations.literal: Tang Ju arrived, entered saw Qin wang.
translations.idiomatic: Tang Ju arrived and entered to see the Qin wang.

sentences.zh: 秦王曰：「丈人芒然乃遠至此，甚苦矣！

translations.literal: Qin wang said: 'Elder confusedly far arrive here, very bitter!
translations.idiomatic: The Qin wang said: 'Elder, you have come so far in confusion. It has been very arduous!'

sentences.zh: 夫魏之來求救數矣，寡人知魏之急已。」

translations.literal: Wei come seek rescue several times, I know Wei urgent already.'
translations.idiomatic: Wei has come to seek rescue several times. I already know Wei's urgency.'

sentences.zh: 唐雎對曰：「大王已知魏之急而救不發者，臣竊以為用策之臣無任矣。

translations.literal: Tang Ju replied said: 'Great wang already know Wei urgent but rescue not send, minister secretly think employ strategy ministers without responsibility.
translations.idiomatic: Tang Ju replied: 'Great wang, you already know Wei's urgency but do not send rescue. This minister secretly thinks the ministers who employ strategy lack responsibility.'

sentences.zh: 夫魏，一萬乘之國也，然所以西面而事秦，稱東藩，受冠帶，祠春秋者，以秦之彊足以為與也。

translations.literal: Wei, ten thousand chariot state, yet west face serve Qin, call eastern fief, receive crown belt, sacrifice spring autumn, because Qin strong enough to ally.
translations.idiomatic: Wei is a state of ten thousand chariots. Yet they face west and serve Qin, call themselves the eastern fief, receive crown and belt, and sacrifice in spring and autumn - all because Qin's strength is sufficient to ally with.

sentences.zh: 今齊、楚之兵已合於魏郊矣，而秦救不發，亦將賴其未急也。

translations.literal: Now Qi, Chu troops already united at Wei suburbs, but Qin rescue not send, also will rely on its not urgent.
translations.idiomatic: Now Qi and Chu's troops have already united at Wei's suburbs, but Qin does not send rescue. They will also rely on the fact that it is not yet urgent.

sentences.zh: 使之大急，彼且割地而約從，王尚何救焉？

translations.literal: Make it greatly urgent, they moreover cut land ally with others, wang still what rescue?
translations.idiomatic: If you make it greatly urgent, they will moreover cut land and ally with others. What rescue will the wang still have?

sentences.zh: 必待其急而救之，是失一東藩之魏而彊二敵之齊、楚，則王何利焉？」

translations.literal: Must wait until urgent rescue it, lose one eastern fief Wei strengthen two enemies Qi, Chu, then wang what benefit?'
translations.idiomatic: To necessarily wait until it is urgent to rescue it is to lose one eastern fief Wei while strengthening two enemies Qi and Chu. Then what benefit does the wang have?'

sentences.zh: 於是秦昭王遽為發兵救魏。

translations.literal: Thus Qin Zhao Wang hurriedly sent troops rescue Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Qin Zhao Wang hurriedly sent troops to rescue Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏氏復定。

translations.literal: Wei clan again stable.
translations.idiomatic: The Wei clan was stabilized again.

sentences.zh: 趙使人謂魏王曰：「為我殺范痤，吾請獻七十里之地。」

translations.literal: Zhao sent people told Wei wang said: 'For me kill Fan Que, I request offer seventy li land.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao sent people who told the Wei wang: 'Kill Fan Que for me, and I will offer seventy li of land.'

sentences.zh: 魏王曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Wei wang said: 'Agreed.'
translations.idiomatic: The Wei wang said: 'Agreed.'

sentences.zh: 使吏捕之，圍而未殺。

translations.literal: Ordered officials capture him, surrounded not yet killed.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered officials to capture him. They surrounded him but did not yet kill him.

sentences.zh: 痤因上屋騎危，謂使者曰：「與其以死痤市，不如以生痤市。

translations.literal: Que thus climbed roof straddled danger, told envoy said: 'Rather with dead Que trade, not as with living Que trade.
translations.idiomatic: Que thus climbed the roof and straddled the danger spot. He told the envoy: 'Rather than trading with dead Que, better to trade with living Que.'

sentences.zh: 有如痤死，趙不予王地，則王將柰何？

translations.literal: If Que die, Zhao not give wang land, then wang will how?
translations.idiomatic: If Que dies and Zhao does not give the wang land, then what will the wang do?

sentences.zh: 故不若與先定割地，然後殺痤。」

translations.literal: Thus not as first settle divide land, then kill Que.'
translations.idiomatic: Thus it is better to first settle on dividing the land, then kill Que.'

sentences.zh: 魏王曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Wei wang said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: The Wei wang said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 痤因上書信陵君曰：「痤，故魏之免相也，趙以地殺痤而魏王聽之，有如彊秦亦將襲趙之欲，則君且柰何？」

translations.literal: Que thus sent letter Xin Ling Jun said: 'Que, former Wei dismissed chancellor, Zhao with land kill Que and Wei wang listens, if strong Qin also will follow Zhao desire, then jun moreover how?'
translations.idiomatic: Que thus sent a letter to Xin Ling Jun: 'Que is a former dismissed chancellor of Wei. Zhao kills Que with land and the Wei wang listens. If strong Qin also follows Zhao's desire, then what moreover will the jun do?'

sentences.zh: 信陵君言於王而出之。

translations.literal: Xin Ling Jun spoke to wang released him.
translations.idiomatic: Xin Ling Jun spoke to the wang and released him.

sentences.zh: 魏王以秦救之故，欲親秦而伐韓，以求故地。

translations.literal: Wei wang because Qin rescue reason, desired befriend Qin attack Han, seek former land.
translations.idiomatic: The Wei wang, because of Qin's rescue, desired to befriend Qin and attack Han to seek former territory.

sentences.zh: 無忌謂魏王曰：

translations.literal: Wu Ji told Wei wang said:
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ji told the Wei wang:

sentences.zh: 秦與戎翟同俗，有虎狼之心，貪戾好利無信，不識禮義德行。

translations.literal: Qin with Rong Di same customs, have tiger wolf heart, greedy fierce good profit no faith, not know ritual righteousness virtue conduct.
translations.idiomatic: Qin shares customs with the Rong and Di. They have the heart of tigers and wolves - greedy, fierce, profit-loving, faithless, unknowing of ritual, righteousness, virtue, and conduct.

sentences.zh: 茍有利焉，不顧親戚兄弟，若禽獸耳，此天下之所識也，非有所施厚積德也。

translations.literal: If have profit, not care relatives brothers, like birds beasts, this world known, not have bestow thickness accumulate virtue.
translations.idiomatic: If there is profit, they do not care about relatives or brothers - they are like birds and beasts. This is known throughout the world. They have not bestowed thickness or accumulated virtue.

sentences.zh: 故太后母也，而以憂死；

translations.literal: Former queen mother, yet died of worry;
translations.idiomatic: The former queen dowager was mother, yet she died of worry.

sentences.zh: 穰侯舅也，功莫大焉，而竟逐之；

translations.literal: Rang Hou uncle, merit none greater, yet finally expelled him;
translations.idiomatic: Rang Hou was uncle, his merit was unsurpassed, yet he was finally expelled.

sentences.zh: 兩弟無罪，而再奪之國。

translations.literal: Two younger brothers no crime, yet twice seized their states.
translations.idiomatic: His two younger brothers had no crime, yet he twice seized their states.

sentences.zh: 此於親戚若此，而況於仇讎之國乎？

translations.literal: This to relatives like this, moreover to enemy states?
translations.idiomatic: If they treat relatives like this, moreover how about enemy states?

sentences.zh: 今王與秦共伐韓而益近秦患，臣甚惑之。

translations.literal: Now wang with Qin together attack Han moreover near Qin calamity, minister very puzzled it.
translations.idiomatic: Now the wang with Qin together attacks Han, moreover bringing near Qin's calamity. This minister is very puzzled by it.

sentences.zh: 而王不識則不明，群臣莫以聞則不忠。

translations.literal: But wang not know then not clear, ministers not hear then not loyal.
translations.idiomatic: If the wang does not know, then he is not enlightened. If the ministers do not inform him, then they are not loyal.

sentences.zh: 今韓氏以一女子奉一弱主，內有大亂，外交彊秦魏之兵，王以為不亡乎？

translations.literal: Now Han clan with one woman support one weak lord, interior have great chaos, exterior ally strong Qin Wei troops, wang think not perish?
translations.idiomatic: Now the Han clan supports one weak lord with one woman. They have great chaos within and ally with strong Qin and Wei troops without. Does the wang think they will not perish?

sentences.zh: 韓亡，秦有鄭地，與大梁鄴，王以為安乎？

translations.literal: Han perish, Qin have Zheng land, close Da Liang Ye, wang think safe?
translations.idiomatic: If Han perishes, Qin will have Zheng territory, close to Da Liang and Ye. Does the wang think it safe?

sentences.zh: 王欲得故地，今負彊秦之親，王以為利乎？

translations.literal: Wang desire get former land, now betray strong Qin friendship, wang think beneficial?
translations.idiomatic: The wang desires to get former territory. Now betraying strong Qin's friendship - does the wang think it beneficial?

sentences.zh: 秦非無事之國也，韓亡之後必將更事，更事必就易與利，就易與利必不伐楚與趙矣。

translations.literal: Qin not idle state, Han perish after must change affairs, change affairs must seek easy profitable, seek easy profitable must not attack Chu Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Qin is not an idle state. After Han perishes, they must change affairs. Changing affairs must seek what is easy and profitable. Seeking easy and profitable, they must not attack Chu or Zhao.

sentences.zh: 是何也？

translations.literal: Why?
translations.idiomatic: Why?

sentences.zh: 夫越山踰河，絕韓上黨而攻彊趙，是復閼與之事，秦必不為也。
